thread.title: Cuomo signs bills for advances towards women's equality
thread.title_full: Cuomo signs bills for advances towards women's equality - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Cuomo signs bills for advances towards women's equality
text:
Bebeto Matthews/AP Gov. Cuomo speaks before signing a series of bills that aims to ensure equality for women in the workplace. ALBANY — Gov. Cuomo on Wednesday signed eight bills to combat gender discrimination in the workplace, sexual harassment and human trafficking.
The bills were part of his Women’s Equality Agenda, which he unveiled last year.
Included were measures that prohibit employers from paying women less than men for equal work, expand the state’s definition of “employer” to make it easier for workers to bring sexual harassment cases and increase penalties for human trafficking.
Related Stories Kathy Hochul vows to take on equality, women's issues and jobs as Cuomo's running mate EXCLUSIVE: Christine Quinn organizing Gov. women's party Hillary Clinton talks equal rights at women’s forum summit
